title: Susanna Reid red-faced as she relives awkward Dan Stevens interview
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Susanna Reid was left red-faced after being kindly reminded about her awkward moment with actor Dan Stevens back in 2014.

Susanna interviewed the Downton Abbey star about his then new role in the film The Guest.

The presenter unknowingly dropped a clanger when she asked Dan if he had to ‘beat off a lot of American men’ to land the part.

As the actor started laughing, Susanna asked: ‘Why does that make you giggle? Did you not have to beat them off? With a big stick?’

Advertisement

The 48-year-old brought up the awkward innuendo on Monday’s Good Morning Britain.

After a segment discussing the possibility of a second Downton Abbey movie, Susanna said: ‘Get Dan Stevens back in. Do you remember that moment?’

When reminded that Dan is no longer in it as his character was killed off, she laughed: ‘That’s a relief for everybody after our last interview.’

Dan Stevens was asked if he had to ‘beat off men’ for his role in The Guest (Picture: ITV)

Her co-host Adil Ray, was was standing in for Piers Morgan, said that he had spoken to Dan about that classic moment.

Adil explained: ‘He came to the cricket, he mentioned that moment and everywhere he goes now people bring it up.’

Susanna went on: ‘I can’t even mention it because the form of words was considered so offensive. I’m so sorry for anyone who was offended back then.

‘[Dan] sent me flowers afterwards to say sorry for making me embarrassed. Isn’t that sweet?’

‘If you don’t know what we’re talking about, after the show you might want to Google Susanna Reid and Dan Stevens,’ Adil said.

Don’t worry, we’re going to save you the trouble. Check out Susanna and Dan’s X-rated exchange below.

Good Morning Britain airs from 6am on ITV.
